#### Step 4: Run the Flask Application
To run the Flask application, go back to the terminal and navigate to the directory where `app.py` is located. Run the following command:

$ python app.py


You should see output similar to the following:
  • Running on http://127.0.0.1:5000/ (Press CTRL+C to quit)

This means that the Flask application is running locally on your machine. You can access it by opening a web browser and navigating to `http://127.0.0.1:5000/`. You should see the message "Hello, Flask!" displayed in the browser.

#### Conclusion
Congratulations! You have successfully installed and used Flask on Ubuntu. You can now start building web applications using Flask and Python.

Remember to deactivate the virtual environment when you're done working on your Flask project. You can do this by running the following command:

$ deactivate


Happy coding!
